title: IBM and the Holocaust
description:
IBM and the Holocaust (HQ PDF)

IBM and the Holocaust is the stunning story of IBM's strategic 

alliance with Nazi Germany -- beginning in 1933 in the first weeks 

that Hitler came to power and continuing well into World War II. As 

the Third Reich embarked upon its plan of conquest and genocide, IBM 

and its subsidiaries helped create enabling technologies, step-by-

step, from the identification and cataloging programs of the 1930s 

to the selections of the 1940s.

More read through the book.......

Author: Michael Hirsh,
Page: 536 pages
Format: PDF
Size: 4.73 Mb
